content.description: Start under the overhang of BB Gun on the same starting holds as 21 Gun Salute. Move out to the start of Sharp Shooter and finish by toping out that problem. Nice extension that makes an already low-percentage problem even lower.
content.location: Under the overhang of BB Gun

content.description: Start matched on the leftmost side of the thin horizontal flake/edge that cuts across the slightly overhung face. Navigate sharp but positive fingertip edges as you traverse right. You start with some less than decent feet, but they disappear about halfway through so you have to smear and get funky high and wide feet at times. Once the edge/flake disappears power straight up through a wide crack-like feature and top out.
content.protection: A pad wold be nice near the topout
content.location: When looking downhill from the Sharp Shooter Boulder, this line is on the downhill side of the rightmost visible boulder.

content.description: The area's name sake for a reason! Start matched in the jug above BB Gun. Power up to the closest pocket, and continue basically straight up to an easy topout. Very low percentage!

Start same as Sharp Shooter, but use the beautiful crescent feature as a gaston to go way up and left to another gaston. Topout straight up. Adding the jug start from the back of the cave is Mendoza Express (V11). Sit starting on Medal of Honor and connecting into PTSD has also been done (V10).

Sit start on left biscuit and right on your choice of undercling/sidepull. Make a hard first move to the deceiving jug, then use tiny sloping crimps to reach a slanted top. Using the small detached boulder for your left foot at the topout is legit.
content.location: On the Sharp Shooter boulder, left of Sharp Shooter.

content.description: Start matched in juggy pocket. Use the thin seam to your left and slopers to your right to get your weight up onto the slabby face. Stand your way to the top.
content.location: Continue past the Sharp Shooter boulder ~30 yards. This is the left most line on the Subtle boulder.

content.description: Get up to the jug rail on your first moves and move right and up around the right side of the bulge overhang.
content.location: Start holds are smack below the middle of the bulge overhang.

content.description: Start with low right hand sidepull, left on slopey arete, and a high right foot. Pull on and slap up the blunt arete to the top.
content.location: On the Subtle boulder, right of Joint Effort.

content.description: Stand start on some good holds and tech your way through easy climbing to the top out.Â
content.location: To the right of the obvious bulging overhang. This route doesn't use holds on the bulge but remains on the face to the right of it.

content.description: A fun techy traverse. Start on left most holds and traverse quality rock to meet up with Basic Training and topout. The obvious jug rail above is off.
content.protection: Maybe a pad below the topout, but your only a foot or so above the ground for the most part
content.location: To the right of the Sharp Shooter and BB gun problem. Traverse begins to the left of the obvious roof, goes under it, and then climbs out on the left side. Sit start on obvious leftmost jug rail.

content.description: The best V3 in this small area. Sit start below Sharp Shooter on the jug rail. Follow the crack feature up and right through a slopey section and topout on good holds.
content.location: On the Sharp Shooter boulder, right of Sharp Shooter.

content.description: Start under the roof of BB Gun on a rough right hand jug, left crimp, and left foot on a chip facing out of the cave. Climb into the start jug of Sharp Shooter, do the move, then traverse left into Medal of Honor and finish up on that. If you consistently climb 5.13s you might think this is a bit easier..
While only a small cluster, the rock is of the utmost quality! About a dozen classics from V0-V10, you could spend your whole day in this small area.
